intro: Brachystegia hockii, commonly known as the Hockii brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to central and eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The tree typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in miombo woodlands. It has a distinctive trunk with a short, thick base and a crown of spreading branches. Its leaves are bipinnate, and it produces small, yellowish flowers followed by legume pods containing seeds.
